messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:47): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, isn't XML 1.1 dead?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:53): I wonder why the chairs are so vocal about splitting... I guess there was some backchannel chatter
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (15:59): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I think it has a lot to do with keeping the choice of external text format independent of HTML5
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (16:00): png, jpeg, ogg, mpeg4 - none of these are specified as part of HTML5
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (16:00): and nor should they by - there may be better formats in the future that the video, audio and img elements will have to support!
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (16:01): it's really the same for external text associations for video and audio and a format definition should not be inside the spec
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:02): text/cache-manifest is in HTML5
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:02): as are text/ping, text/html-sandboxed, application/microdata+json

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:03): Has anyone argued that it *should* be defined in the HTML5 document? (rather than arguing that it doesn't matter where the text exists for now and it's a waste of effort to worry about it before we even know whether it's a good enough solution that it should continue to exist)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:03): Ian has
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (16:04): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: are those supposed to be used outside the Web by other apps, too?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:05): 040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721, whether there will be better formats in the future is somewhat orthogonal to where formats are specified
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (16:05): not if the only format that is acceptable is the one inside the spec

7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (16:05): 040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721, at least where the consensus is clear ‚Äî with the img element ‚Äî it would be good to document it. after all, png, gif, jpeg ARE all supported in almost every browser.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:06): if we want to make more formats acceptable we change the spec
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (16:06): without baseline formats you get compatibility nightmares
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (16:06): you can call a format a baseline format without having it specified inside the spec
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (16:06): we wouldn't include the theora specification into html5, either, to make it a baseline format
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (16:07): 040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721, how would an implementor know then if it isn't included ?
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (16:07): a mere sentence that this is the baseline format and a link to its specification would be completely sufficient

040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (16:08): honestly, my mind boggles at the sheer idea that somebody implementing support for WebSRT in their desktop captioning application has to deal with the whole HTML5 spec!
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:08): why would they have to deal with the whole spec?
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (16:09): because as it's part of the HTML5 spec, how will they know there is nothing in the rest of the spec that is not relevant to their implementation
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:09): also these are not the reasons brought forward for splitting
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (16:09): they are my reasons
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:09): sure
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (16:09): and I have brought them forward
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:10): sure
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:10): but they are not what started this IRC thread :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:10): anyway, it seems that simply reading the WebSRT section should give them all the answers
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (16:11): seems I have to keep up with the spec reading!
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:12): e.g. text/cache-manifest might get separate tool support as well

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:13): it's pretty easy to just read the part on text/cache-manifest to figure out how to construct such files and how to read them (e.g. if you write some kind of optimization tool)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:13): some definitions are reused but they are all clearly hyperlinked
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:14): I don't really see what all the fuss is about; it mostly seems a lot of hand waving without much clear scenarios

040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (16:16): look at it this way: software is not written as one big main function either - stuff that is reused elsewhere is split into libraries - WebSRT is a "library" for me
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (16:17): and the spec is too long for its own good anyway - takes ages to load in any browser!
